intro: Ionidium commune var. circaeoides, commonly known as the common ionidium variant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale green to white in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly rough texture, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinator populations.
